summary: brendan rodgers has n't disciplined raheem sterling or jordon ibe for the incident . sterling was exposed for inhaling the legal high nitrous oxide on monday . then 24 hours later pictures emerged of sterling and ibe with shisha pipes . rodgers would not discuss whether he would give gerrard , available after a three-match suspension .

aspect: 1. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities.
2. Sterling and Ibe were pictured with shisha pipes.
3. Rodgers spoke to Sterling and Ibe about their responsibilities and the incident.
4. Rodgers wants to draw a line under the matter and has not disciplined them.
5. Rodgers wants to focus on steering Liverpool into their first FA Cup final.
6. Rodgers believes Liverpool are ready to progress after falling short last season.
7. Rodgers thinks losing is part of the journey and players should learn from it.
explain: Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe were reprimanded by Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers for their actions involving nitrous oxide and shisha pipes.

The aspect highlights that Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe were seen smoking shisha pipes just 24 hours after pictures were published of Sterling inhaling Nitrous Oxide. This suggests that they were engaging in dangerous behavior despite being reprimanded by their coach, Brendan Rodgers. It raises questions about the level of discipline and responsibility of Sterling and Ibe, as well as the expectations set by their coach.

Brendan Rodgers spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordan Ibe to discuss their responsibilities and the incident where they were seen with nitrous oxide and shisha pipes. He stressed on the importance of discipline and responsible behavior.

The given aspect explains that Brendan Rodgers does not want to punish Raheem Sterling or Jordon Ibe for their recent incident. He desires to move on from the matter and has not taken any disciplinary action against them.

Rodgers wants to stay focused on the bigger picture of getting Liverpool into their first FA Cup final rather than getting distracted by disciplinary issues involving Sterling and Ibe. 
Core Idea: Rodgers is committed to keeping his team focused on their goals and staying disciplined, even in the face of controversial incidents.

Rodgers believes that Liverpool are ready to progress after falling short of their goal last season. This means that the manager has confidence in his team and feels that they have what it takes to improve upon their previous performance and achieve their objectives. He likely has a plan in place to help the team grow and move forward towards success.
Brendan Rodgers believes that losing is an inevitable part of the journey towards success and that his players must learn to cope with it as they continue to progress in their respective careers.
